Instruction to create the fields in Word: 

1. Click on 'File' top left of the window

2. Select in the left column 'Info'

3. On the right of the page, click on 'Properties' and select 'Advanced Properties'

4. A window will open with 5 different tabs, select 'Custom' (the last one)

5. Create the label/format for the field: 
	a) Give a name: e.g. field_name
	b) Select a type (usually Text)
	c) Possibility to set a default value, or simply press enter to insert an empty space
	d) Select Add

6. For more fields, repeat point 5. 

Next step, insert the fields in the Word document: 

7. Go back to the Word document page

8. Select the location where you want to add the field. 

9. Select the 'Insert' tab

10. Under the 'Text' section, select 'Quick Parts'

11. A small drop-down will open, select 'Field'

12. Under 'Field' select 'Document Information' in the drop-down selection of 'Categories'. 

13. Select 'DocProperty' in the 'Field names:' selection box

14. Finally choose the name (e.g. field_name) of the field you want to add in that location. 


Check if the fields are present: 

X. Go back to the Word visualisation and press Alt + F9. All the fields should appear as follows: {DOCPROPERTY field_name \* MERGEFORMAT}. Press again Alt + F9 not to print the fields in the output.
